thread.title: Jeremy McConnell tweets he’s had an ‘amazing few days’ after spending time with ex-girlfriend Stephanie Davis and their son Caben in Liverpool
thread.title_full: Jeremy McConnell tweets he’s had an ‘amazing few days’ after spending time with ex-girlfriend Stephanie Davis and their son Caben in Liverpool

author: sduff
title: Jeremy McConnell tweets he’s had an ‘amazing few days’ after spending time with ex-girlfriend Stephanie Davis and their son Caben in Liverpool
text:
Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments JEREMY McConnell is delighting in fatherhood now that he is confirmed as the father of on-off lover Stephanie Davis’ son. 
The 26-year-old reality star shared his joy and happiness after spending days in Liverpool to be with Steph and their one-month-old son Caben-Albi. Alamy 7 Jeremy McConnell has spent time with Stephanie Davis this past week 
Jeremy – who met Steph while starring on Celebrity Big Brother in January 2016 – took to Twitter to express his happiness late on Friday night. 
“Had an amazing few days, feeling blessed,” the reality star wrote along with a heart emoji. Related articles SHE SOUNDS OAK-AY EX-Hollyoaks star Abi Phillips aiming to prove she made the right decision quitting acting job – by singing on The Voice bieber in 'sick' rap Justin Bieber accused of pulling a sickie to avoid a court appearance are you gavin a laugh? The Voice judge Gavin Rossdale forced to choose last act after being snubbed by 17 potential recruits PAXMAN'S LOVE SPLIT Jeremy Paxman splits from Elizabeth Clough, his partner of 35 years IF DICAP FITS Supermodel Nina Agdal showcases the killer curves that bagged her Titanic star Leo 'Vulnerable and exposed' Ross Kemp survived the threat of kidnap whilst making a show about the migrant crisis in Libya 'They're the bane of my life!' James Nesbitt says camera phones have made being a famous face a nightmare sunny delight Jamie Oliver injects some holiday fun into our lives with his stifado-style souvlaki and tasty tzatziki face off SPOILER ALERT EastEnders' Denise is at breaking point and loses her cool with wannabe villain Keegan BABY BOOM Coronation Street's Leanne gives birth and it's far from straightforward tv picks What's on TV tonight? Shows to watch on Saturday 18 February from The Voice UK to Let it Shine Back together? Hollyoaks' Ste and John Paul look ready to reunite but will something get in the way? 
Jez’s update comes the day after it was revealed he had spent at least five days in Liverpool after rushing to be by ex-girlfriend Stephanie Davis’s side this weekend. 
The former couple remain together in the North West as they continue to mend their damaged relationship. Twitter Jeremy McConnell wanted the world to know how happy he is Instagram Jeremy took a DNA test to prove his paternity of baby Caben-Albi Rex Features Jeremy McConnell is still in Liverpool five days after rushing to be by ex-girlfriend Stephanie Davis’s side this weekend 
A source said: “Jeremy is still in Liverpool with Stephanie at the moment. 
“They’re using this time to get to know each other again away from the cameras and things are going well. It’s been an emotional couple of days for them both but they’re beginning to see light at the end of the tunnel. 
“Jeremy was keen not to miss out on any more time with Caben and Stephanie agrees it’s important for him to be there.” 
The Irish model made the unexpected trip to Liverpool this weekend to be with his baby and ex-girlfriend in a meeting that sources close to the couple say went “extremely well.” Jeremy McConnell talks to Bizarre’s Dan Wootton about ex Stephanie Davis and baby claims Splash News Stephanie and Jeremy remain together in the North West as they continue to mend their failed relationship Splash News 7 Jeremy was keen not to miss out on any more time with Caben and Stephanie agrees it’s important for him to be there 
A source said: “Jeremy spent the weekend in Liverpool and finally got to meet his son for the first time – and spent some time with Steph too. 
“Caben is well and truly their priority now – nothing else matters other than the health and happiness of the baby.” 
Their long running feud came to an end last week when the one time lovers held peace talks , which led to Jeremy’s stay this week in Liverpool. 
The Sun’s Bizarre column revealed the pair were willing to put their differences aside after Jeremy confirmed he is the father of Stephanie’s son. Bond Media Agency The ex-couple reunited this week following their bitter feud as sources confirm their peace talks are going well 
A source said: “Stephanie and Jeremy are back on speaking terms. 
“They’re trying to rebuild a civilised relationship for the sake of Caben – they both knew that the situation had to change for things to move forward. 
“It’s going to be a slow process but they’re gradually heading in the right direction.” 
But close pals of the pair believe their truce could lead to further romance and that Jeremy visiting Steph in Liverpool could be the start of much more. 
A source said: “There has always been a spark there even if it did end badly the first time round. “They have a child together now – everything’s changed.”
